data.title: AMP for Email
data.description: Support for rendering emails in the AMP format.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported on all compatible evergreen browsers. Refer to 'supported platforms' links listed below under resources.
Supported. But a default style of `margin:auto` is applied on every element and can prevent the expected result.

data.title: animation
data.description: Tests for the shorthand `animation` property and its longhand equivalents.

notes_by_num.1: Buggy. Animation properties are supported but `@keyframes` are incorrectly prefixed.

data.title: aspect-ratio
data.description: Sets a preferred aspect ratio for the element

notes_by_num.1: Requires iOS 15.

data.title: @font-face
data.description: `@font-face` in CSS allows to include your own fonts inside an email.
data.keywords: font face, web fonts, google fonts

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Only supported through a `<link>` tag.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Only supported directly through a `<style>` tag.
notes_by_num.3: Buggy. Support depends on the version of IE installed.
notes_by_num.4: Partial. The declaration is supported but distant fonts are ignored.
notes_by_num.5: Buggy. Elements using a font declared with `@font-face` ignore the font stack and fall back to Times New Roman. Use `mso-generic-font-family` and `mso-font-alt` to control the fallback.
notes_by_num.6: Not supported. Roboto and Google Sans can be used, but only because they're embedded with the webmail's own styles.
notes_by_num.7: Not supported. The `@font-face` declaration is kept but the `src` property is removed.
notes_by_num.8: Not supported when using a Microsoft email address; outlook, live, hotmail, etc..

data.title: @import
data.description: This is the description of the `@import` property.

notes_by_num.1: Buggy. `@keyframes` are incorrectly prefixed.

data.title: @media (-webkit-device-pixel-ratio)
data.keywords: media queries, media query, media feature

notes_by_num.1: Buggy. The first rule inside a media query is not prefixed.

data.title: @media (orientation)
data.keywords: media queries, media query, media feature, portrait, landscape

notes_by_num.1: Buggy. The first rule inside a media query is not prefixed.

data.title: @media (prefers-color-scheme)
data.description: This media query allows to theme for system light and dark mode.
data.keywords: media queries, media query, media feature, dark mode, light mode

notes_by_num.1: Not supported. `@media (prefers-color-scheme)` is transformed into `@media ( _filtered_a )`.
notes_by_num.2: Not supported. `@media (prefers-color-scheme:dark)` is transformed into `@media none`.

data.title: @media (prefers-reduced-motion)
data.keywords: media queries, media query, media feature, prefers-reduced-motion, animation, accessibility

notes_by_num.1: Not supported. `@media (prefers-reduced-motion:reduce)` is transformed into `@media none`.

data.title: @media
data.keywords: media queries, media query, media feature

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Does not support nested media queries.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Only supports `screen`, `min-width`, `max-width`, `min-height` and `max-height` based media queries.
notes_by_num.3: Buggy. Requires a double `<head>` hack to work.
notes_by_num.4: Partial. Does not support simple `@media {}` declarations.
notes_by_num.5: Buggy. The first rule inside a media query is not prefixed.
notes_by_num.6: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.
notes_by_num.7: Partial. Does not support height based media queries.

notes_by_num.1: Properties not supported by the client are replaced by `_filtered_a` inside the parenthesis.
notes_by_num.2: Not supported. `@supports` is transformed into `@media not all`.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.
Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts. But it can be used in the `background` shorthand property instead.
Buggy. Only supports [color keywords from CSS Level 1](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#color_keywords).
Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. Requires at least one `` element in the email to download all images.
notes_by_num.3: Partial. Does not support multiple values. The comma between two values is removed.
notes_by_num.4: Partial. Images URL must be between quotes.
notes_by_num.5: Background images can be used in VML. See [backgrounds.cm](https://backgrounds.cm/) and [VML documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/vml/web-workshop---how-to-use-vml-on-web-pages-----fill--element).

notes_by_num.1: Background images origin can be used in VML with the `origin` attribute. See [VML documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/vml/origin-attribute--fill--vml).
Partial. Does not support multiple values. The comma between two values is removed.
notes_by_num.2: Background images position can be used in VML with the `position` attribute. See [VML documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/vml/position-attribute--fill--vml).

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Does not support multiple values. The comma between two values is removed.
notes_by_num.2: Background images repetition can be used in VML with the `type="tile"` or `type="frame"` attribute. See [VML documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/vml/type-attribute--fill--vml).

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts. But it can be used in the `background` shorthand property instead.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Does not support multiple values. The comma between two values is removed.
notes_by_num.3: Background images size can be used in VML with the `size` attribute. See [VML documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/vml/size-attribute--fill--vml).

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Does not support multiple values. The comma between two values is removed.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Does not support the `/ value` shorthand for `background-size`. But it can be used in the `background-size` property instead.
notes_by_num.3: Partial. Only `background-color` values are supported.
notes_by_num.4: Partial. Images URL must be between quotes.
notes_by_num.5: Partial. Does not support multiple values. The entire property is removed if so.
notes_by_num.6: Partial. Does not support the `/ value` shorthand for `background-size`.

data.title: border-radius
data.description: The `border-radius` CSS property rounds the corners of an element's outer border edge.

notes_by_num.1: Round corners can be used in VML with the `RoundRect` element. See [buttons.cm](https://buttons.cm/) and [VML documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/vml/msdn-online-vml-roundrect-element).
notes_by_num.2: Partial support. Shorthand for setting elliptical borders with the slash `/` notation is not supported e.g. `border-radius: 27% 73% 70% 30% / 30% 34% 66% 70%;`.

data.title: border
data.description: The `border` properties set an element's border. This page accounts for all `border` longhands and shorthands.
data.keywords: border-width, border-style, border-color, border-top, border-bottom, border-left, border-right, border-top-width, border-top-style, border-top-color, border-bottom-width, border-bottom-style, border-bottom-color, border-left-width, border-left-style, border-left-color, border-right-width, border-right-style, border-right-color
data.notes: This pages reports support for all CSS properties related to `border`: `border`, `border-width`, `border-style`, `border-color`, `border-top`, `border-bottom`, `border-left`, `border-right`, `border-top-width`, `border-top-style`, `border-top-color`, `border-bottom-width`, `border-bottom-style`, `border-bottom-color`, `border-left-width`, `border-left-style`, `border-left-color`, `border-right-width`, `border-right-style`, `border-right-color`.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. A border can not be bigger than 8px.
notes_by_num.2:
Buggy. Unreliable if used on a `

` or a `

`.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Only supported with non Gmail accounts.

data.title: caption-side
data.description: The `caption-side` CSS property puts the content of a table's `<caption>` on the specified side.

notes_by_num.1: The `caption-side` property in CSS is supported but the `<caption>` HTML element is not.
Partial. `path()` is not supported.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. [Embedded SVG](/features/html-svg/) is not supported. Referencing an embedded SVG's `<clipPath>` with `url()` does not work.
notes_by_num.3: Partial. Referencing an external SVG's `<clipPath>` with `url()` does not work.

data.title: direction
data.description: Sets the direction of text or table columns.

notes_by_num.1: Buggy. The client applies an `rtl` direction to the entire email if it contains text in a `rtl` language.
Not supported with non Gmail accounts.
notes_by_num.2: `display:inline-flex` is not supported.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Does not inherit onto nested `<table>` elements.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Does not work when applied directly to an `` element.

data.title: display
data.description: Sets whether an element is treated as a block or inline element and the layout used for its children.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. `flex`, `grid`, `flow-root`, `contents`, `inline flow-root`, `inline flex`, `inline grid`, `initial`, `revert`, `unset` are not supported with Non Gmail Accounts.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. `inline-flex`, `inline-grid`, `flex`, `grid`, `flow-root`, `contents`, `inline flow-root`, `inline flex`, `inline grid`, `initial`, `revert`, `unset` values are not supported.
notes_by_num.3: Buggy. Only the first value is kept with the two-value syntax.
notes_by_num.4: Buggy. `display:none` does not inherit to inner tables.
notes_by_num.7: Partial. Two-value syntax are combined into a single one with a dash.

data.title: filter
data.description: Tests with values `blur`, `brightness`, `grayscale`, `hue-rotate`, `invert`, `opacity`, `saturate`, `sepia` and `shadow`.

notes_by_num.1: Partial support. `<number>` values are not supported as per CSS Fonts Level 4 where any `<number>` value between 1 and 1000 (inclusive) is a valid value. Only the following numeric values are supported: 100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, and 900.
Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.

data.title: clamp()
data.description: Support for the CSS `clamp()` function.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with Non Gmail Accounts.

data.title: max()
data.description: Support for the CSS `max()` function.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with Non Gmail Accounts.

data.title: min()
data.description: Support for the CSS `min()` function.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with Non Gmail Accounts.
Buggy. Replaces `height` by `min-height`.
notes_by_num.2:
Partial. Not supported on ``, ``, `
` or `

` elements.

data.title: !important keyword
data.description: An `!important` declaration takes precedence over a normal declaration.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Only supported in lowercase. (See [email-bugs#13](https://github.com/hteumeuleu/email-bugs/issues/13))
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Only supported inline when using a Non Gmail Account due to the lack of `<style>` support.
notes_by_num.3: Not supported. The entire declaration is removed if there is no space before `!important`.
notes_by_num.4: Partial. Only supported with a space before.
notes_by_num.6: Partial. Only supported inline due to the lack of `<style>` support.
notes_by_num.7: Partial. Removed if there is no space before when used with a `background-image` property. (See [email-bugs#16](https://github.com/hteumeuleu/email-bugs/issues/16))

notes_by_num.1: Partial. `left` and `top` are not supported.
Partial. Big negative values are rendered differently from CSS standards.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. Values set in `em` are smaller than the expected render in CSS. See [#192](https://github.com/hteumeuleu/caniemail/issues/192).

data.title: line-height
data.description: Sets the height of a line box. Or, basically, the height of a line of text.

notes_by_num.1: Buggy. `em` and `px` units behave weirdly. Use `mso-line-height-rule:exactly`.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. `normal` value is not supported.

data.title: linear-gradient()
data.description: Creates an image consisting of a progressive transition between two or more colors along a straight line.

notes_by_num.1: Gradients can be created in VML using `type="gradient"` on a `<v:fill>`. See [VML documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/vml/web-workshop---how-to-use-vml-on-web-pages-----fill--element#gradient-fill).
Not supported, but the proprietary `mso-bullet-image` property can be used instead on `<li>`. Outlook 2007 and 2010 only support `.ico` and `.gif` file formats.
notes_by_num.2: Not supported, but image values are supported through the `list-style` shorthand property.
notes_by_num.3: `url()` is transformed into `proton-url()`.

notes_by_num.1: Not supported, but the proprietary `mso-text-indent-alt` property can be used instead.

data.title: list-style-type
data.notes: Tests and support are based on the CSS Level 2 specification. `<custom-ident>`, `symbols()` and `<string>` values are not tested here.

data.title: list-style
data.notes: Tests and support are based on the CSS Level 2 specification. `<custom-ident>`, `symbols()` and `<string>` values are not tested here.

notes_by_num.1: `list-style-image` values are not supported. The entire `list-style` property is removed if present.
notes_by_num.2: Only `list-style-type` values are supported.
notes_by_num.3: `list-style-image` values are not supported but the rest of the `list-style` property is kept.
notes_by_num.4: `url()` is transformed into `proton-url()` for `list-style-type` values, invalidating the entire property.

data.title: margin
data.description: Support for the `margin` shorthand property and the `margin-left`, `margin-right`, `margin-top`, `margin-bottom` properties.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Negative values are not supported.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Not supported on `<span>` and `<body>` elements.
notes_by_num.3: Buggy. `background-color` is included inside the `margin`.
notes_by_num.4: Partial. `auto` value is not supported.

data.title: max-height property
data.description: Sets the maximum height of an element.

data.title: max-width
data.description: This is the description of the `max-width` property.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Only works on `<table>` elements.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Doesn't work on `<table>` elements, as per [CSS 2.1 specification](https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/visudet.html#min-max-widths).

data.title: min-height property
data.description: Sets the minimum height of an element.

data.title: min-width property
data.description: Sets the minimum width of an element.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with Non Gmail Accounts.

data.title: object-fit
data.description: The `object-fit` CSS property sets how the content of a replaced element, such as an `` or `

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.

data.title: object-position
data.description: The `object-position` CSS property specifies the alignment of the selected replaced element's contents within the element's box. Areas of the box which aren't covered by the replaced element's object will show the element's background.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.

data.title: outline
data.description: Sets a line outside of the element's border.
data.notes: WebKit renders square outline even when using `border-radius`.

notes_by_num.1: Buggy. Cannot scroll through to hidden content.
notes_by_num.2: Not supported. `overflow` is replaced by `java-script`.

data.title: padding
data.description: This test includes support for the `padding` shorthand property as well as for `padding-left`, `padding-right`, `padding-top` and `padding-bottom`.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Only supported on table cells.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. Vertical padding will be the same for all cells of a same row, adopting the biggest value.

data.title: position
data.description: Tests for CSS positioning include `relative`, `absolute`, `fixed` and `sticky`.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Supports `relative`, `absolute` but not `sticky` and `fixed`.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Supports `sticky` but not `relative`, `absolute` and `fixed`.
notes_by_num.3: Partial. Supports `relative` but not  `absolute`, `sticky` and `fixed`.
notes_by_num.4: Partial. Supports `relative` and `sticky` but not `absolute` and `fixed`.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Only supported on type selectors.
Partial. Only supported on type selectors.
notes_by_num.2: Not supported. `<input>` elements are transformed into `<noinput>`.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Only supported on type selectors.
Partial. Only supported on type selectors.
Partial. Only supported on type selectors.

data.title: :has()
data.description: Represents an element if any of the selectors passed as parameters match at least one element.
data.notes: As of december 2021, `:has()` is only supported in [Safari Technology Preview 137](https://webkit.org/blog/12156/release-notes-for-safari-technology-preview-137/). As of march 2022, it is supported in Safari 15.4.

notes_by_num.1: Not supported. `:has(…)` is replaced by `:has`.
notes_by_num.2: Not supported. But the pseudo-class seems interpreted and computed server side.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Only supported on type selectors.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Only supported on type selectors.
Partial. Only supported on type selectors.
Partial. Only supported on type selectors.

notes_by_num.2: Not supported. Removes the parenthesis part.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Only supported on type selectors.
notes_by_num.2: Not supported. Removes the parenthesis part.

notes_by_num.2: Not supported. Removes the parenthesis part.

Partial. Only supported on type selectors.
Partial. Only supported on type selectors.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. Not filtered but doesn't work.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Only supported on type selectors.
Not supported with non Outlook accounts.
notes_by_num.2: The pseudo-element is supported but the `content` property is not.

notes_by_num.1: Not supported with non Outlook accounts.
notes_by_num.2: The pseudo-element is supported but the `content` property is not.

Not supported with non Outlook accounts.
Not supported with non Outlook accounts.

data.title: radial-gradient()
data.description: Creates an image consisting of a progressive transition between two or more colors that radiate from an origin.

notes_by_num.1: Gradients can be created in VML using `type="gradientRadial"` on a `<v:fill>`. See [VML documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/vml/web-workshop---how-to-use-vml-on-web-pages-----fill--element#gradient-fill).

data.title: rgb()
data.description: RGB functional notation (`rgb()`)

notes_by_num.1: Whitespace syntax is not supported (`rgb(0 128 0 / 1)`).
notes_by_num.2: Alpha value is not supported (`rgb(0, 128, 0, 0.5)`).
notes_by_num.3: whitespace syntax (`rgb(0 128 0)`): when used in the `style` attribute of an element, the whole attribute is stripped. When used inside `<style>`, the whole `<style>` block is stripped.

data.title: rgba()
data.description: RGB functional notation with alpha-channel transparency value (`rgba()`)

notes_by_num.1: Whitespace syntax is not supported (`rgb(0 128 0 / 1)`).
notes_by_num.2: whitespace syntax (`rgba(0 128 0 / 1)`): when used in the `style` attribute of an element, the whole attribute is stripped. When used inside `<style>`, the whole `<style>` block is stripped.

data.title: Adjacent sibling combinator
data.description: The adjacent sibling combinator (`h1 + p`) allows to target an element that is directly after another.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.

data.title: Attribute selector
data.description: The attribute selector (`[attr]`) targets elements with this specific attribute.
data.notes: This page reflects support for different syntaxes: `[attr]`, `[attr="value"]`, `[attr~="value"]`, `[attr|="value"]`, `[attr^="value"]`, `[attr$="value"]`, `[attr*="value"]`.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Can not be used with a class selector (`.test[class]`). Must be used solo (`[class]`) or with an element selector (`td[class]`).
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Only supports `[attr]`, `[attr=value]`, `[attr~=value]`, `[attr|=value]` syntaxes.
notes_by_num.3: Buggy. A `class="test"` in the HTML is prefixed `class="x_test"`, but an attribute selector stays unprefixed `[class="test"]`.
notes_by_num.4: Partial. Only supports `[attr=value]` syntax.
notes_by_num.6: Partial. Doesn't work with Non Gmail Accounts.

data.title: Chaining selectors
data.description: Chaining selectors (`.foo.bar`) allows to apply styles to elements matching all the corresponding selectors.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. The first `<head>` in the HTML is removed, so `<style>` elements need to be in a second `<head>` element.
notes_by_num.3: Buggy. Styles will be applied to the first selector of the chain.
notes_by_num.4: Buggy. Only the first selector of the chain is prefixed in the styles, but all classes are prefixed in the HTML.

data.title: Child combinator
data.description: The child combinator is represented by a superior sign (`>`) between two selectors and matches the second selector if it is a direct child of the first selector.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. The first `<head>` in the HTML is removed, so `<style>` elements need to be in a second `<head>` element.

data.title: Class selector
data.description: The class selector (`.className`) allows to apply styles to a group of elements with the corresponding `class` attribute.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. The first `<head>` in the HTML is removed, so `<style>` elements need to be in a second `<head>` element.

data.title: Descendant combinator
data.description: The descendant combinator is represented by a space (` `) between two selectors and matches the second selector if it has ancestor matching the first selector.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. The first `<head>` in the HTML is removed, so `<style>` elements need to be in a second `<head>` element.

data.title: General sibling combinator
data.description: The general sibling combinator (`img ~ p`) allows to target any element that after another (directly or indirectly).

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.

data.title: Grouping selectors
data.description: Grouping selectors (`.foo, .bar`) allows to apply the same styles to the different corresponding elements.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. The first `<head>` in the HTML is removed, so `<style>` elements need to be in a second `<head>` element.

data.title: ID selector
data.description: The ID selector (`#id`) allows to apply styles to an element with the corresponding `id` attribute.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. The first `<head>` in the HTML is removed, so `<style>` elements need to be in a second `<head>` element.

data.title: Type selector
data.description: Type selector or element selectors allow to apply styles by HTML element names.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. The first `<head>` in the HTML is removed, so `<style>` elements need to be in a second `<head>` element.

data.title: Universal selector *
data.description: The universal selector (`*`) allows to apply styles to every elements.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. The first `<head>` in the HTML is removed, so `<style>` elements need to be in a second `<head>` element.
notes_by_num.3: Not supported. The selector is removed and left prefixed with the outer most parent element.

data.title: text-align
data.description: Sets the horizontal alignment of the content.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Flow-relative values `start` and `end` are not supported.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Flow-relative values `start` and `end` are not supported with non Gmail account.

data.title: text-decoration-color
data.notes: `text-decoration-color` is not supported in Internet Explorer.

notes_by_num.1: Supported with prefix `-webkit-`.
notes_by_num.2: Not supported, but the proprietary `text-underline-color` property can be used instead.
notes_by_num.3: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.

notes_by_num.1: Supported with prefix `-webkit-`.
notes_by_num.2: Not supported, but the proprietary `text-underline-style` property can be used instead with the keyword value `thick`.

data.title: text-decoration
data.description: Tested with the values `overline`, `underline` and `line-through`.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Not supported with multiple values.
notes_by_num.3: Partial. `overline` is not supported.

data.title: text-indent
data.description: Support below refers to supporting a `<length>` value only. This does not include the new `each-line` or `hanging` keywords.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Negative values are not supported.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Hard-coded negative values are not supported, but negative values as a result of the `calc()` function are supported.

data.title: text-overflow
data.description: Tested with the value `ellipsis`.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.
notes_by_num.2: Not supported. `overflow` is replaced by `java-script`.

data.title: text-transform
data.description: Each of the six `text-transform` values defined by MDN (`capitalize`, `uppercase`, `lowercase`, `none`, `full-width`, `full-size-kana`).
data.notes: Currently, only Firefox supports the `full-width` and `full-size-kana` property values. Web clients on Firefox will support these properties.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. `lowercase` value is not supported.

data.title: transform
data.description: Tested with values `matrix`, `translate`, `scale`, `rotate`, `skew`, `scale translate`.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. `scale translate` is not supported.

data.title: CSS calc() function
data.description: Support for CSS calc function.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.

data.title: ch unit
data.description: Support for ch unit, relative to the width of a '0'.

data.title: cm unit
data.description: Support for centimeters unit

data.title: em unit
data.description: Support for em unit, relative to the current font-size.

data.title: ex unit
data.description: Support for ex unit, relative to the height of an 'x'.

data.title: in unit
data.description: Support for inches unit

data.title: initial unit
data.description: Support for initial keyword value.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Webmail rendering doesn't work in IE.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.

data.description: Support for millimeters unit

data.description: Support for picas unit

data.description: Support for rem unit, relative to the root font-size.

data.description: Support for viewport width unit.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. The `var()` function is supported, but not the variable declaration.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Fixed attachment is not supported.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Slash syntax values are not supported.
notes_by_num.3: Partial. Values containing background images are not supported.
notes_by_num.4: Buggy. For slash syntax values, it removes the slash character, making the value invalid.
notes_by_num.5: Partial. Seems to only support background colors.

data.title: visibility
data.description: Tested for values `hidden` and `collapse`.

notes_by_num.1: Buggy. `visibility:collapse` applied to a `<tr>` only hides content and does not "remove" it from layout.
notes_by_num.2: Partially supported. `visibility:collapse` is not supported.

data.title: white-space
data.description: Tested with the values `nowrap` and `pre`.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. `pre` value is not supported.

notes_by_num.1: Buggy. Percentage width on `` elements are based on the physical file's width, not on the parent element's width.
notes_by_num.2:
Partial. Not supported on ``, ``, `
` or `

` elements.
notes_by_num.3: Buggy. The webmail has a generic style that sets `table { width:inherit; }`.

data.title: word-break
data.description: Prevents or allows words to be broken over multiple lines.

notes_by_num.1: Supported. But Gmail adds `<wbr>` every 30 characters.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. Supported but a `word-wrap:break-word` is applied, making it look like `break-all`.
notes_by_num.3: Partially supported. Only `word-break:break-all` works.
notes_by_num.4: Buggy. Every value is replaced by `break-word`.

data.title: align attribute
data.description: This deprecated HTML attribute indicates how an element can be aligned, either horizontally (`left`, `center` or `right`) or vertically for elements like images (`top`, `middle`, `bottom`).

notes_by_num.1: Partial. `` elements are wrapped in a `` so `left` and `right` values have no effect.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Not supported on `` elements.

data.title: Local anchors
data.keywords: hash, fragment identifiers, URLs, URIs, document fragments, local, named, anchor, anchors, links

notes_by_num.1: Buggy. `target=_blank` is added on links so anchors open in a new window.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. Anchor links go back to the homepage of the webmail because it also uses anchor links for navigation.
notes_by_num.3: Buggy. Clicking an anchor link does nothing.
notes_by_num.4: Buggy. Opens a new browser window with the anchor as a URL.
notes_by_num.5: Buggy. Opens a new in-app browser window on yahoo.com with the anchor appended to the URL.
notes_by_num.6: Buggy. Targeted content is partially hidden by the application UI on top.
notes_by_num.7: Partial. Works when targeting an empty anchor with the corresponding `name` attribute, but not with `id` attributes.
notes_by_num.8: Not supported. Opens a new window with the same email.
notes_by_num.9: The `name` and `href` attributes are prefixed by a specific `mailruanchor_` prefix.

notes_by_num.1: Buggy. `id` prefix mismatched. The `id` value is prefixed but not the `aria-describedby` value.
Buggy. `id` is removed.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. `id` prefix mismatched. The `id` value is prefixed but not the `aria-describedby` value.

notes_by_num.1: Unable to trigger live change to test.
notes_by_num.2: Code isn't stripped but can't trigger a live change.

data.title: <audio> element
data.description: This is the description of the `<audio>` element.

notes_by_num.1: Does not play.
notes_by_num.2: The `src` attribute is transformed into `proton-src`.
notes_by_num.3: The `<audio>` element is supported but can not be played.
notes_by_num.4: The `<audio>` element is supported, but the video can not play due to a strict Content Security Policy.
notes_by_num.5: Not supported. The `<audio>` element and all its content is removed.
notes_by_num.6: Not supported. The `src` attribute is replaced by `data-src`.

data.title: background attribute
data.description: The HTML `background` attribute can only be used on `<body>`, `<table>`, `<td>` and `<th>` elements.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Only supported on the `<body>` element.

data.title: <base>
data.description: Specifies the base URL to use for all relative URLs in a document.

notes_by_num.1: Buggy. The element is removed but URLs are still correctly computed in links `href` attribute.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. URLs are computed based on the first `<base>` element found in the `<body>`.
notes_by_num.3: Buggy. URLs are computed based on the last `<base>` element found in the `<body>`.
notes_by_num.4: Buggy. Not supported for local anchor links.

notes_by_num.1: Buggy. Blockquote elements are nested in a `<details>` element.

data.title: <body> element
data.description: Represents the content of an HTML document.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Replaced by a `<div>` with supported attributes.

data.title: <button type="reset"> element
data.description: HTML button type reset

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. Interacting with the element submits the form it belongs in.
notes_by_num.3: Partial. The element is present but is not interactive.

data.title: <button type="submit"> element
data.description: HTML button type submit

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. The element is present but is not interactive.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.

data.title: dir attribute
data.description: Indicates the directionality of the element's text.

notes_by_num.1: Buggy. The client applies an `rtl` direction to the entire email if it contains text in a `rtl` language.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Removed from `<table>` and `<td>` elements.
notes_by_num.3: Buggy on anchor `<a>` tags.
notes_by_num.4: Buggy. LTR text in `[dir=rtl]` (and vice versa) is rendered with reversed word order.

data.title: <div> element
data.notes: This page reflects support for the `<div>` semantic HTML element. But in order to support _the Outlooks_ (2007-2019) on Windows, it is still recommended to use tables.

notes_by_num.1: Buggy. Renders as if there was no doctype with an Outlook email, and in HTML5 otherwise.
notes_by_num.2: Not supported. The HTML5 doctype has no impact here.
notes_by_num.3: Partial support. Depends on the version of Internet Explorer installed.

data.title: <form> element
data.description: The ability to submit an HTML form via email, this requires support of at least one form element, at least one form method and either input submit or button submit to pass data to an end point.

notes_by_num.1: Does not submit in iOS with non Gmail accounts.
notes_by_num.2: On submit name values are prefixed with `x_`.
notes_by_num.3: Does not submit in preview pane, but does when the email is opened in a new window.
notes_by_num.4: Not supported. `<form>` is transformed into `<noform>`.
notes_by_num.5: Not supported. The `<form>` and its entire content is removed.
notes_by_num.6: Not supported. The `<form>` is there but values are not submitted.

data.title: <h1> to <h6> elements
data.description: Support for headings elements in HTML: `<h1>`, `<h2>`, `<h3>`, `<h4>`, `<h5>`, `<h6>`.
data.keywords: headings, h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6

notes_by_num.1: The webmail sets `<h1>` to `color:#fff` and `<h2>` to `background:#354963`.
Buggy. Percentage width on `` elements are based on the physical file's width, not on the parent element's width.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. Sizes set in attributes don't scale in 120 dpi mode.

data.title: Image maps
data.description: `` with a `usemap` attribute and associated `` with a `name` attribute and descendant `` elements define a client-side image map.
data.keywords: image maps, map element, area element, usemap attribute

data.description: HTML input type checkbox

notes_by_num.1: Not supported. `<input>` is transformed into `<noinput>`.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. Interacting with the element submits the form it belongs in.

notes_by_num.1: Not supported. `<input>` is transformed into `<noinput>`.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.

data.title: <input type="text"> element
data.description: HTML input type text

notes_by_num.1: Buggy. Email scrolls to the end when space bar is pressed.  This can be fixed by wrapping the `<input>` in `<ul role="presentation">`.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. Screen jumps when input is in focus.
notes_by_num.3: Buggy. A number of Android clients will not show the keyboard when the input is clicked. Copy and pasting text works.
notes_by_num.4: Not supported. `<input>` is transformed into `<noinput>`.
notes_by_num.5: Buggy. Interacting with the element submits the form it belongs in.

data.title: lang attribute
data.description: The `lang` attribute lets you declare the language of the content of an HTML element.

notes_by_num.1: Not supported on `<td>` elements.

data.title: <ul>, <ol> and <dl>
data.description: Support for lists in HTML: `<ul>`, `<ol>`, `<li>`, `<dl>`, `<dt>` and `<dd>` elements.
data.keywords: ul, ol, li, dl, dt, dd

data.title: loading attribute
data.description: The `loading` attribute on `img` indicates how the browser should load the image.

notes_by_num.1: The `loading` attribute is supported, but not confirmed whether it works according to spec.
notes_by_num.2: The `loading` attribute is supported by the email client, but not by the browser engine.
notes_by_num.3: Not supported. The webmail adds `loading="lazy"` to all images.

data.title: mailto: links
data.description: The `mailto:` URL scheme allows to create links that open a new outgoing email message. It supports different parameters corresponding to header fields, like `cc`, `bcc`, `subject` and `body`.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. `cc` and `bcc` are not supported.
notes_by_num.2: Not supported. The link opens a contact card inside the app.
notes_by_num.3: Partial. `bcc` is not supported.

data.title: <marquee> element
data.description: This is the description of the `<marquee>` element.

notes_by_num.1: The `<marquee>` element is supported but the animation doesn't play in Internet Explorer or Firefox.
notes_by_num.2: The `behavior` attribute is not supported.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Supported with Non Gmail Accounts only.
Partial support. Does not support Videos resources.
notes_by_num.2: Partial support. Does not support PDF resources.
notes_by_num.3: Not supported. `<object>` is turned into `<noobject>`.
notes_by_num.4: Not supported. The `<object>` element and all its content is removed.

data.title: <picture> element
data.description: This is the description of the `<picture>` element.

notes_by_num.1: `<picture>` and `<source>` tags are replaced by `<u></u>` tags.
Partial. Supported with Non Gmail Accounts only.

data.title: required attribute
data.description: Required attribute on form elements

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Only supported with non Gmail accounts.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. The `required` attribute is supported, but form elements are not.

notes_by_num.1: Not live tested, only looked at processed code on Litmus.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Only works on the `<table>` tag.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Supported with Non Gmail Accounts only.
Partial. Supported with Non Gmail Accounts only.
Partial. Supported with Non Gmail Accounts only.

data.title: <select> element
data.description: HTML select menu

notes_by_num.1: Buggy. Works if the email is shorter than the viewport. Otherwise the screen goes blank when the `<select>` is in focus.
notes_by_num.2: Not supported. `<select>` is transformed into `<noselect>`.
notes_by_num.3: Buggy. Interacting with the element submits the form it belongs in.

data.title: HTML5 semantics
data.description: This includes support for `<article>`, `<aside>`, `<details>`, `<figcaption>`, `<figure>`, `<footer>`, `<header>`, `<main>`, `<mark>`, `<nav>`, `<section>`, `<summary>`, `<time>` elements.
data.keywords: article, aside, details, figcaption, figure, footer, header, main, mark, nav, section, summary, time

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Only `<time>` is supported.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. `<details>`, `<main>`, `<nav>` and `<summary>` are not supported. Opening and closing tags are replaced by `<u></u>`.
notes_by_num.3: Partial. `<article>` is not supported.
notes_by_num.4: Unsupported opening and closing tags are stripped.

data.title: <small> element
data.description: The `<small>` HTML element represents side-comments and small print, like copyright and legal text, independent of its styled presentation.

data.title: srcset and sizes attributes
data.description: This is the description of the `srcset` and `sizes` attributes.

notes_by_num.1: `<picture>` and `<source>` tags are replaced by `<u></u>` tags.
notes_by_num.2: The `sizes` attribute is supported but not `srcset`.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported with non Gmail accounts.

data.title: <style> element
data.description: An HTML element to contain style information, in CSS, for a document or part of a document.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Not supported inside the `<body>`.
notes_by_num.2: Partial. Not supported with Non Gmail Accounts.
notes_by_num.3: Buggy. The first `<head>` in the HTML is removed, so `<style>` elements need to be in a second `<head>` element.
notes_by_num.4: Buggy. `<style>` elements need to be declared before their rules are used.
notes_by_num.5: A CSS rule following a CSS comment is ignored. (See [email-bugs#25](https://github.com/hteumeuleu/email-bugs/issues/25).)

data.title: Embedded <svg> image
data.description: Support for embedded `<svg>` images. See [SVG html](/features/image-svg) for linked external SVG support.

notes_by_num.1: Buggy. Requires a background on the `<body>`. Can be any type of background, image or a color, can be set as attribute, inline style or in `<style>` block

data.title: target attribute
data.description: Where to display the linked URL on `<a>` elements.

notes_by_num.1: Not supported. `target="_blank"` is forced on all links.
notes_by_num.2: Supported. But `target="_blank"` is forced if the attribute is missing.
notes_by_num.3: The attribute is supported but links always open in a new window anyway.

data.title: <textarea> element
data.description: HTML input type text

notes_by_num.1: Buggy. Email scrolls to the end when space bar is pressed.  This can be fixed by wrapping the `<input>` in `<ul role="presentation">`.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. Screen jumps when input is in focus.
notes_by_num.3: Buggy. A number of android clients will not show the keyboard when the input is clicked.  Copy and pasting text works.
notes_by_num.4: Not supported. `<textarea>` is transformed into `<notextarea>`.
notes_by_num.5: Buggy. Interacting with the element submits the form it belongs in.

notes_by_num.1: Buggy. The attribute is supported, but the webmail has default styles setting all `<td>` to `vertical-align:top` in CSS.
The `<video>` element is supported, but not the inner `<source>` element so no video can play.
notes_by_num.2: `<video>`, `<source>` and `<track>` tags are replaced by `<u></u>` tags.
notes_by_num.3: Buggy. Support depends on the version of Internet Explorer installed.
notes_by_num.4: `<video>`, `<source>` and `<track>` tags are stripped. The fallback content is shown instead.
notes_by_num.5: Partial support. Requires the `controls` attribute to play.
notes_by_num.7: The `<video>` element is supported and the `poster` image is visible, but the video can not play due to a strict Content Security Policy.
notes_by_num.8: The `<video>` element is supported, but the video can not play due to a strict Content Security Policy.
notes_by_num.9: Not supported. The `<video>` element and all its content is removed.
notes_by_num.10: Not supported. The `src` attribute is replaced by `data-src`.

notes_by_num.1: Partial. Supported with Non Gmail Accounts only.
Buggy. Percentage width on `` elements are based on the physical file's width, not on the parent element's width.
notes_by_num.2: Buggy. Sizes set in attributes don't scale in 120 dpi mode.
notes_by_num.3: The `width` attribute is ignored on CID embedded images. See [#171](https://github.com/hteumeuleu/caniemail/issues/171).

data.title: Animated PNG image format
data.description: Support for animated PNG image format
data.notes: In all cases where the Animated PNG fails, it will fallback to show the first frame of the animation.

data.title: Video as Image Assets
data.description: WebKit in Safari supports loading H.264 encoded MP4 video with an HTML tag or as a CSS background.
data.notes: As of may 2021, using Video as Image Assets is only supported in WebKit and Safari.

notes_by_num.1: Only supported in Safari.
